questions.question: When does the III B.Tech I Semester begin in 2025?
questions.answer: The semester begins on 7 July 2025.

questions.question: What is the last working day of the semester?
questions.answer: The semester ends on 4 December 2025, followed by end exams.

questions.question: What subjects are taught in III B.Tech I Sem CSE-B section?
questions.answer: Subjects include: DAA, Computer Networks, Web Technologies, Data Analytics, Information Retrieval Systems (IRS), and Intellectual Property Rights (IPR).

questions.question: How many credits are there in III B.Tech I Semester?
questions.answer: The semester has a total of 25 credits including theory, lab, and elective subjects.

questions.question: What is the minimum attendance required to appear for exams?
questions.answer: A minimum of 75% attendance is mandatory to be eligible for semester-end exams.

questions.question: When does the second semester begin after this one?
questions.answer: The II Semester begins on 5 December 2025, right after the I Semester ends.

questions.question: When is the Parent Teacher Meeting scheduled?
questions.answer: It is scheduled for 20 September 2025.

questions.question: How are holidays adjusted in the timetable?
questions.answer: Some working Saturdays are scheduled (e.g., 13 September 2025) to compensate for holidays.

questions.question: What is the NSS activity planned for this semester?
questions.answer: A Blood Donation Drive is planned in the second week of August 2025.

questions.question: Where can students check their daily class timetable?
questions.answer: Each section (A, B, C, D) has a separate timetable published and distributed by the department.

questions.question: When are the first mid-term exams (CIE-I) scheduled?
questions.answer: From 8 September to 12 September 2025.

questions.question: When are the second mid-term exams (CIE-II)?
questions.answer: From 10 November to 14 November 2025.

questions.question: When will end-semester exams be held?
questions.answer: From 24 November to 4 December 2025.

questions.question: What is the lab internal exam period?
questions.answer: From 28 August to 4 September 2025.

questions.question: What are the instructions for lab internals?
questions.answer: Students must wear formal dress, bring ID card and observation notebooks, and avoid electronic gadgets.

questions.question: What is the re-registration process?
questions.answer: Students with subject detentions must re-register between 1–4 September 2025, paying ₹3,000 per subject.

questions.question: What is the Code Tantra assessment?
questions.answer: A mandatory online technical assessment for III Year students to qualify for CRT (Campus Recruitment Training).

questions.question: When are the Code Tantra assessments held?
questions.answer: Between 11 July and 18 July 2025 for all III Year branches.

questions.question: What happens if I fail the Code Tantra test?
questions.answer: Students must attend remedial sessions, and failure to qualify may affect their placement training eligibility.

questions.question: What are the exam timings?
questions.answer: Theory exams: 1:30 PM – 3:30 PM | Lab internals: 12:55 PM – 3:55 PM (Afternoon).

questions.question: When is Varalakshmi Vratam holiday?
questions.answer: 8 August 2025.

questions.question: When is Ganesh Chaturthi holiday?
questions.answer: 27 August 2025.

questions.question: When is Milad-un-Nabi holiday?
questions.answer: 5 September 2025.

questions.question: When is Ganesh Immersion holiday?
questions.answer: 6 September 2025.

questions.question: When is the Dussehra Recess?
questions.answer: From 29 September to 4 October 2025.

questions.question: When is the second Saturday holiday in August?
questions.answer: 9 August 2025.

questions.question: Which Saturday is marked as a working day?
questions.answer: 13 September 2025 is a working Saturday.

questions.question: Are festivals given full-day holidays?
questions.answer: Yes, major festivals like Ganesh Chaturthi, Milad-un-Nabi, and Dussehra have full-day holidays.

questions.question: Are there special events for Teacher’s Day?
questions.answer: Yes, Teacher’s Day (5 September) usually includes internal college celebrations, though it coincides with a holiday in 2025.

questions.question: Are NSS activities considered holidays?
questions.answer: No, they are voluntary events conducted during college hours or weekends.

questions.question: What is the transport fee deadline for III Year students?
questions.answer: The deadline is 18 July 2025.

questions.question: Is there any concession for final-year students?
questions.answer: Yes, IV Year students receive a 75% fee concession on transport fees.

questions.question: What is the penalty for late fee payment?
questions.answer: Late fee payment can lead to fines and restrictions on hall ticket issuance.

questions.question: When did Campus Recruitment Training (CRT) begin?
questions.answer: CRT started on 7 July 2025.

questions.question: What is the structure of CRT?
questions.answer: CRT is conducted weekly, focusing on aptitude, coding, and interview preparation, integrated into the timetable.

questions.question: Do students need to qualify for CRT?
questions.answer: Yes, students must pass the Code Tantra assessment to be eligible for CRT.

questions.question: What accreditation does Sreyas Institute hold?
questions.answer: The college is NAAC A-Grade accredited and has NBA accreditation for major programs.

questions.question: What happens if I don’t pay transport fees on time?
questions.answer: Bus services will not be provided, and you may face restrictions in administrative services.

questions.question: Is attendance mandatory for CRT sessions?
questions.answer: Yes, attendance is compulsory as it is part of the curriculum.

questions.question: Are circulars communicated only via notice boards?
questions.answer: No, they are also shared via college portals and sometimes through WhatsApp groups.

questions.question: Who is eligible for scholarship renewal in 2025?
questions.answer: Students from BC, EBC, Minority, SC, and ST categories are eligible, subject to academic and attendance criteria.

questions.question: What is the last date to apply for scholarship renewal?
questions.answer: The deadline is 30 August 2025.

questions.question: What documents are required for scholarship renewal?
questions.answer: Previous year’s marks memo, income certificate, caste certificate, Aadhaar card, and bank account details.

questions.question: Where should I submit the scholarship application?
questions.answer: Apply online first, then submit a hard copy with documents at the college scholarship section.

questions.question: What happens if I miss the scholarship deadline?
questions.answer: You will not be considered for renewal, and no late applications are accepted.

questions.question: What is fee reimbursement?
questions.answer: Fee reimbursement is a government scheme that reimburses tuition fees for eligible students.

questions.question: Who can apply for fee reimbursement?
questions.answer: BC, EBC, Minority, SC, and ST students who meet eligibility criteria (income, attendance, academics).

questions.question: Does fee reimbursement cover exam fees?
questions.answer: No, exam fees must usually be paid separately by the student.

questions.question: Can scholarship and fee reimbursement be availed together?
questions.answer: Yes, students who qualify can receive both.

questions.question: Who to contact for scholarship-related help?
questions.answer: The college scholarship in-charge or administrative office can provide guidance and resolve queries.

questions.question: How many books can a student issue from the library?
questions.answer: A student can issue up to 3 books at a time for a period of 15 days.

questions.question: What happens if a student returns a library book late?
questions.answer: A fine of ₹5 per day will be charged for late return of library books.

questions.question: Hi
questions.answer: Hello! How can I help you today?

questions.question: I need help
questions.answer: Sure! Please tell me your query, I’ll guide you.

questions.question: Thank you
questions.answer: You’re welcome! Happy to help anytime.

questions.question: Bye
questions.answer: Goodbye! Have a great day ahead.
